snippet: The national chairman for Ron Paul explained Mr. Paul’s delay in arriving after the Iowa caucuses: “He just wanted to go home.”
abstract: Republican presidential hopeful Ron Paul makes his first campaign appearance in New Hampshire three days after the Iowa caucuses, prompting grumbling from some of his supporters and raising questions about whether he is serious about winning the primaries in the state.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Katharine Q. Seelye in Dublin, N.H.; Trip Gabriel in Newport, N.H.; and Marjorie Connelly in New York.

lead_paragraph: The national chairman for Ron Paul explained Mr. Paul’s delay in arriving after the Iowa caucuses: “He just wanted to go home.”

headline.main: Paul, After Texas Detour, Gets Back to the Campaign
headline.print_headline: Paul, After Texas Detour, Gets Back to the Campaign
